intro: Cybianthus wurdackii, commonly known as the Wurdack's cybianthus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive shape that aids in attracting pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
